Soon unfrozen, the form-changing alien wreaks havoc, creates terror and becomes one of them. :: 286 :: See movie reviews below. :: 287 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 288 :: The Thing Collector's Edition takes it place as one of the finest DVDs on the market. Universal has included everything of possible interest here: a fascinating commentary by Kurt Russell and the film's director John Carpenter; an extensive (80 minutes!) documentary on the film's making that includes stop-motion photography not used in the film; the theatrical trailer; outtakes; a photo album, storyboards and Thing concept art and a production archive (extensive notes of the film's production history). :: 289 :: Ultimately, The Thing is given the same outstanding collector's edition treatment that Universal has given Psycho and Vertigo. Universal is getting better with each collector's edition. The documentaries are more extensive and the collections more fascinating. And, The Thing benefits from the higher picture quality inherit with DVD. This new transfer looks exceptional. The sound has been re-recorded into Dolby Digital 5.1-which adds tremendously to the film's overall nightmarish effect. :: 290 :: This DVD is an exceptional opportunity to see the film in the best format possible for home viewing - and for fans of the film (and who couldn't be after seeing it?) a day's worth of extras to view and study. Along the way, they discover more action than they could ever want and, surprisingly, their humanity. :: 303 :: See movie reviews below. :: 304 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 305 :: The Three Kings DVD is especially praiseworthy, demonstrating the astonishing degree of craft and care that went into creating the film. Not only are you given a tour of the sets, for example, but you also get CNN footage of the Gulf War. The image is in 2.35:1 anamorphic widescreen, and the sound is in Dolby Digital 5.1. Extras include two commentaries from Russell and the producers; featurettes; video diaries; deleted scenes; production stills; and a funny, razor-sharp dissection of the surreal universe of modern filmmaking from Jonze, the director of Being John Malkovich. :: 306 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 307 :: 	George Clooney :: 308 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=17794 :: 309 :: , :: 310 :: Mark Wahlberg :: 311 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=162838 :: 312 :: , :: 313 :: Ice Cube :: 314 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20000218 :: 315 :: , :: 316 :: Jamie Kennedy :: 317 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=179146 :: 318 :: , :: 319 :: Spike Jonze :: 320 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20005876 :: 321 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 322 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/28363298.jpg :: 323 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=28363298&trkid=28 :: 324 :: 	<BR/> :: 325 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 326 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 327 :: 	Being John Malkovich :: 328 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=28363298&trkid=28 :: 329 :: 	<BR/> :: 330 :: 	Take a hallucinogenic trip minus the drugs but with all the fun. Now the secret has been unleashed. And its discovery may mean the end of all humanity. :: 292 :: The plague to end all plagues... When a terrorist bomb destroys a building in Dallas, Texas, FBI Agents Fox Mulder (David Duchovny) and Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) are drawn into a dangerous conspiracy surpassing anything they've ever encountered. With the dubious assistance of a paranoid doctor (Academy Award winner Martin Landau), Mulder and Scully risk their careers and their lives to hunt down a deadly virus which may be extraterrestrial in origin, and could destroy life on earth. Their pursuit of the truth pits them against the mysterious Syndicate, powerful men who will stop at nothing to keep their secrets safe, leading the agents from a cave in Texas, to the halls of the FBI and finally to a secret installation in Antarctica which holds the greatest secret of them all. :: 293 :: See movie reviews below. :: 294 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 295 :: A very nicely put-together disc. The film is only in widescreen, which is great -- wasn't the whole point of the exercise to see Mulder and Scully in 1.85:1 as opposed to the 1.33:1 you see them in every week? There's great sound (THX-certified Dolby 5.1 and 2.0 for English with French 2.0), and the English and Spanish subs are nice -- even if Fox's subtitler doesn't seem to know that you defuse a bomb, you don't diffuse it. On an extras level, the commentary by X-Files creator and screenwriter Chris Carter and director Rob Bowman is OK, while the featurette is an interesting behind-the-scenes look. The DVD also includes the three original theatrical trailers, which are terrific -- exciting without being too revealing, enigmatic without being obscure. :: 296 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 297 :: 	David Duchovny :: 298 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=26029 :: 299 :: , :: 300 :: Gillian Anderson :: 301 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=11638181 :: 302 :: , :: 303 :: Martin Landau :: 304 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=52410 :: 305 :: , :: 306 :: William B. Confidential) and a superb supporting cast to ignite Payback's explosive mix of story, stars and style. :: 288 :: The dynamic superstar portrays Porter, a career criminal bent on revenge after his partners in a street heist pump metal into him and take off with his $70,000 cut. Bad move, thugs. Because if you plan to double-cross Porter, you'd better make sure he's dead. Porter resurfaces, wading into a lurid urban underworld of syndicate kingpins, cops on the take, sniveling informants and deadly gangs. Porter wants his money back. And the way he sets out to get it assures that, from beginning to heartpounding end, Payback pays off big. :: 289 :: **Philip Wuntch, Dallas Morning News :: 290 :: See movie reviews below. :: 291 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 292 :: The look and sound of this DVD are exceptional. Winner of five Academy Awards including Best Director, the film also captured Oscars for Cinematography, Film Editing, Sound and Sound Effects Editing. More than 70 critics (including those at Time magazine, USA Today, The New York Times and Entertainment Weekly) and critics' groups in New York, Chicago, Dallas-Ft. Worth and Great Britain named the film Best Picture of the Year, while the Los Angeles, Toronto and Broadcast Film Critics honored it with both Best Picture and Best Director awards. In addition, Spielberg received his third Directors Guild of America Award, the American Legion The Spirit of Normandy Award, a USO Merit Award from the USO of Metropolitan Washington, as well as the highest civilian public service award from the Department of the Army. Selected for more than 160 Top Ten lists, Saving Private Ryan's other honors include Golden Globes for Best Picture (Drama) and Best Director, the Producers Guild of America Award and ten nominations from the British Academy Film Awards. Saving Private Ryan was the top-grossing motion picture of 1998. :: 303 :: Seen through the eyes of a squad of American soldiers, the story begins with World War II's historic D-Day invasion, then moves beyond the beach as the men embark on a dangerous special mission. Captain John Miller (Tom Hanks) must take his men behind enemy lines to find Private James Ryan, whose three brothers have been killed in combat. Faced with impossible odds, the men question their orders. Why are eight men risking their lives to save just one? Surrounded by the brutal realities of war, each man searches for his own answer â€“ and the strength to triumph over an uncertain future with honor, decency and courage. :: 304 :: See movie reviews below. :: 305 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 306 :: A 1.85:1 anamorphic widescreen picture with Dolby Digital 5.1 sound, but saying that doesn't do justice to how well this disc captures the movie's cinematography, sound and feel. The transfer is first-rate. There are English subtitles and other extras, including A Special Message from Steven Spielberg, promoting the D-Day museum. :: 307 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 308 :: 	Tom Hanks :: 309 :: You know the number. Ian Fleming's James Bond is back, as Albert R. Broccoli presents the 17th installment of the most successful film franchise in history. Pierce Brosnan takes on the role of legendary Agent 007 in the most ambitious James Bond adventure ever to explode onto the big screen. Goldeneye delivers all the pulse-pounding action, spectacular effects, torrid sexuality and trademark wit that have made James Bond a favorite of audiences the world over. :: 290 :: See movie reviews below. :: 291 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 292 :: You'll be shaken :: 293 :: <EM> and </EM> :: 294 :: stirred by all the features packed into this Special Edition: audio commentary by director Martin Campbell and producer Michael G. Wilson, a video diary about the making of the film, a cheesy featurette called The World of 007, 12 television spots, two theatrical trailers and the Tina Turner music video. The 2.35:1 anamorphic widescreen transfer (subtitled in English and French) is sharp, with the English soundtrack in Dolby Digital 5.1 and the French in Dolby 2.0. :: 295 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> In addition to being a well told tale, Apollo 13 is by far the ... :: 391 :: 	Complete Review :: 392 :: 	 	MovieDisplay?movieid=262866&trkid=4368&dmode=netflixreview :: 393 :: 	<STRONG> Featured Member Reviews </STRONG> :: 394 :: 	Write your own online review! :: 395 :: 	MovieDisplay?movieid=262866&trkid=4368&dmode=enterreview :: 396 :: 	<BR/> :: 397 :: 	97 Customer Reviews :: 398 :: 	MovieDisplay?movieid=262866&trkid=4368&dmode=customerreview :: 399 :: 	<STRONG> Reviews Voted Most Helpful </STRONG> :: 400 :: 	Votes are counted & displayed within 24 hours :: 401 :: <EM> ___tariq___ </EM> :: 402 :: <BR/> :: 403 :: ( :: 404 :: Read more about me ... :: 405 :: http://www.netflix.com/Profile?prid=45151910 :: 406 :: ) :: 407 :: <STRONG> 58 </STRONG> :: 408 :: out of :: 409 :: <STRONG> 61 </STRONG> :: 410 :: people found this review helpful. :: 411 :: When I was a kid, all I really wanted to be was an astronaut. And I'll admit this film is in some ways as close as I'll ever get to the inside of a real spacecraft. This film is beautifully made -- the set looks like the Johnson Space Center, like Cape Canaveral, and as much like the inside ... :: 412 :: Complete Review :: 413 :: MovieDisplay?movieid=262866&trkid=4368&dmode=customerreview&reviewId=141647#141647 :: 414 :: I found this review :: 415 :: <EM> Indicat </EM> :: 416 :: <STRONG> 5 </STRONG> :: 417 :: out of :: 418 :: <STRONG> 9 </STRONG> :: 419 :: people found this review helpful. :: 420 :: This was a whole lot more interesting the first time. i.e. watching it happen on the news as a kid. As a movie it was a real dud. :: 421 :: I found this review :: 422 :: <EM> Teresa Murray </EM> :: 423 :: <STRONG> 4 </STRONG> :: 424 :: out of :: 425 :: <STRONG> 7 </STRONG> :: 426 :: people found this review helpful. :: 427 :: These days good family movies which hold the attention and entertain all ages rarely exist. It was a wonderful, emotional, realistic movie that my 13yr old son even found facinating. No one is quicker than Butch Cassidy when it comes to get-rich-quick schemes, and his sidekick Sundance is a wizard with a gun. When these two bungling train robbers tire of running from the law, they set out for Bolivia with Sundance's girlfriend. Though they can barely speak enough Spanish to communicate This is a stick-up, that's only a minor detail to the two nicest bad guys who ever rode in the West. :: 300 :: See movie reviews below. :: 301 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 302 :: The disc is loaded with nice extras. There's a commentary by Hill, lyricist Hal David, Hall and dialogue coach Robert Crawford; a making-of documentary; and 1994 interviews with Goldman, Redford, Newman, Ross and songwriter Burt Bacharach. There are also extensive trailers, documentation about the film's genesis and production notes. The image is in a beautiful 2.35:1 anamorphic widescreen, and the sound is in Dolby Digital 5.1 and 2.0. :: 303 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 304 :: 	Paul Newman :: 305 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=68009 :: 306 :: , :: 307 :: Robert Redford :: 308 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=76851 :: 309 :: , :: 310 :: Katharine Ross :: 311 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=80044 :: 312 :: , :: 313 :: Strother Martin :: 314 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=59943 :: 315 :: , :: 316 :: Henry Jones :: 317 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=46850 :: 318 :: , :: 319 :: Jeff Corey :: 320 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20015024 :: 321 :: , :: 322 :: George Furth :: 323 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20000737 :: 324 :: , :: 325 :: Cloris Leachman :: 326 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=53608 :: 327 :: , :: 328 :: Ted Cassidy :: 329 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20004686 :: 330 :: , :: 331 :: Kenneth Mars :: 332 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20004141 :: 333 :: , :: 334 :: Donnelly Rhodes :: 335 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20012015 :: 336 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 337 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/60010248.jpg :: 338 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60010248&trkid=28 :: 339 :: 	<BR/> :: 340 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 341 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 342 :: 	Comes a Horseman :: 343 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60010248&trkid=28 :: 344 :: 	<BR/> :: 345 :: 	A ruthless cattle baron (Jason Robards, Jr.) stops at nothing to acquire the land bordering his property. Demonic forces time warp him - and his '73 Oldsmobile - into England's Dark Ages, where he romances a beauty (Embeth Davidtz) and faces legions of undead beasts, including a ghastly army of skeletons. Can Ash save the living from the evil dead, rescue his girlfriend, and get back to his own time? :: 286 :: Overflowing with spectacular special effects, Army of Darkness will make you scream with fear and laughter. In the words of The Washington Post, it's drop-dead fun! :: 287 :: See movie reviews below. :: 288 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 289 :: This is a great looking and sounding DVD - in fact, this is the best looking version available of the film. Why Universal would not release this as Special Edition when they do so with such minor achievements like Street Fighter is beyond my understanding. This is a fascinating, complicated film that was put together with lots of spit, glue, and tape, and all of it looks great. The production story is present in a limited way in the production notes, but the film deserves a commentary and a documentary. The film also deserves the alternate scenes, especially the different endings for which it is famous. Instead, we have this straight-high quality-transfer with the trailer and the cast and production notes. We wait for a Special Edition. :: 290 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 291 :: 	Bruce Campbell :: 292 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=13822 :: 293 :: , :: 294 :: Embeth Davidtz :: 295 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=22150 :: 296 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 297 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/731595.jpg :: 298 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=731595&trkid=28 :: 299 :: 	<BR/> :: 300 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 301 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 302 :: 	Mallrats :: 303 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=731595&trkid=28 :: 304 :: 	<BR/> :: 305 :: 	Suburban auteur Kevin Smith forgoes the convenience-store environs of Clerks for the mall in this hilarious look at love and loss between the escalators. :: 305 :: For four years, the crew of the NSEA Protector donned their uniforms and set off on thrilling and often dangerous missions in space--then their series was canceled. Twenty years later, the five stars of the classic '70s TV series Galaxy Quest are still in costume, making appearances at science fiction conventions for their legions of die-hard fans. But some of those fans are a little more far out than the actors could ever have imagined. :: 306 :: A group of aliens who have mistaken intercepted television transmissions for historical documents arrive at a convention and whisk Commander Peter Quincy Taggart (Tim Allen) and his crew into space to help them in their all-too-real war against a deadly adversary. With no script, no director, and no clue about real interstellar travel, the make-believe crew of the Protector has to turn in the performances of their lives to become the heroes the aliens believe them to be. :: 307 :: See movie reviews below. :: 308 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 309 :: A nice presentation in 2.35:1 anamorphic widescreen, with deleted scenes, a featurette, production notes, cast and crew bios, the theatrical trailer and three soundtracks: English in Dolby Digital 5.1 and 2.0, and a Thermian 2.0 track. The Thermian audio track features the entire film dubbed in the aliens' howling, hooting language -- a cute idea that quickly wears thin. :: 310 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 311 :: 	Tim Allen :: Like others in his country, he is weary of the British ravaging villages and abducting wives. After one particularly devastating pillage, Wallace rallies his countrymen and starts the battle cry for freedom. Knowing full well what they're up against, Wallace leads his people in one of history's most gut-wrenching quests for liberation. Full of ripe detail, this adventurous saga will linger in your memory. :: 306 :: See movie reviews below. :: 307 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 308 :: A good DVD package. For the conclusion of this feature, you will need to rent Lawrence of Arabia: Disc 2. </STRONG> :: 288 :: Director David Lean follows the heroic true-life odyssey of T.E. Lawrence (Peter O'Toole) in this dramatic portrait of the famed British officer's journey to the Middle East. Assigned to Arabia during World War I, Lawrence courageously unites the warring Arab factions into a strong guerrilla front and leads them to brilliant victories in treacherous desert battlefields where they eventually defeat the ruling Turkish Empire. :: 289 :: See movie reviews below. :: 290 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 291 :: The anamorphic 2.2:1 widescreen image was taken from the recent restoration of the 70mm print. The movie is split across two discs, with all the extras on the second disc, including an hourlong making-of featurette, a conversation with Steven Spielberg about the film, several featurettes from the premiere and more. Audio is available in Dolby Digital 5.1 and 2.0. All in all, a superb presentation of a classic, and Columbia-TriStar should be commended for its effort. :: 292 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 293 :: 	Peter O'Toole :: 294 :: If you'd like to see the bonus disc, please rent :: 300 :: <STRONG> Gladiator: Bonus Disc </STRONG> :: 301 :: . :: 302 :: Upon the sudden death of Roman emperor Marcus Aurelius, his trusted and successful general Maximus is unlawfully imprisoned and condemned to the gladiator games by Marcus's twisted son Commodus. As the new emperor, Commodus fears Maximus could use his heroic stature to depose him and become leader himself. But Maximus gains fame as a gladiator and uses his celebrity to cause further damage to Commodus' tenuous hold on the susceptible Roman people, hoping to inspire them to rediscover their lost values and overcome the corruption that is eating away at them. These actions prompt Commodus to square off mano a mano with Maximus in the Colisseum with the fate of Rome at stake. The characters of Marcus Aurelius and Commodus appeared in Anthony Mann's epic Fall of the Roman Empire:, played by Alec Guinness and Christopher Plummer, respectively. :: 303 :: See movie reviews below. :: 304 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 305 :: The disc is in anamorphic 2.35:1 widescreen format; audio choices include DTS surround sound, Dolby 5.1 and Dolby 2.0. Commentary by Scott, director of photography John Mathieson and editor Pietro Scalia is sorted into chapters exploring the practical and the ideological aspects of the movie. :: 306 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: That's the upside, and it's considerable. But Gladiator could have been one of the best films of the year. He takes up arms alongside his idealistic patriot son, Gabriel, and leads a rebel American Militia into battle against a relentless and overwhelming Redcoat army. In the process, he discovers that the only way to protect his family is to fight for a young nation's liberty. But his dark past haunts him. :: 305 :: See movie reviews below. :: 306 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 307 :: Special features include commentary by Emmerich and producer Dean Devlin. A visual-effects interactive feature walks you through two scenes: How a Patriot Loses His Head and Recreating a Digital Army. Then along comes methodical predator Gary Soneji (Michael Wincott), who commits a daring kidnapping and lures Cross into the case. :: 290 :: Soneji's not out for ransom, he wants something much bigger - a place in the history books. His every move is planned with the precision of a spider spinning his web. :: 274 :: Awards :: 275 :: javascript:void(0); :: 276 :: <BR/> :: 277 :: http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/icons/maltin.gif :: 278 :: javascript:void(0); :: 279 :: Leonard Maltin Recommends :: 280 :: javascript:void(0); :: 281 :: <BR/> :: 282 :: http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/icons/official_site.gif :: 283 :: http://studio.go.com/movies/obrother/ :: 284 :: Official Movie Site :: 285 :: http://studio.go.com/movies/obrother/ :: 286 :: <BR/> :: 287 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/buy_jumbo_bestbuy.gif :: 288 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/JRedirect?ctr=Best+Buy+%28Default%29&page=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsearch%2Fsr10.asp%3Fm%3D270%26Page%3D%26SC%3Dtitle%26SV%3DO+Brother+Where+Art+Thou :: 289 :: <STRONG> Synopsis </STRONG> :: 290 :: <BR/> :: 291 :: <BR/> :: 292 :: Ulysses Everett McGill (George Clooney) is a garrulous, silver-tongued petty criminal having some difficulty adjusting to the regimentation of life as a man sentenced to a term of hard labor in Mississippi. :: 293 :: Reluctant to spend any more time crushing rocks, he scams his way off the chain gang with a clumsy duo of fellow convicts: sweet and simple Delmar (Tim Blake Nelson) and the maladjusted Pete (John Turturro). The trio embarks on the adventure of a lifetime as they set out to pursue their freedom and the promise of sharing in the division of a fortune in buried treasure. However, they must also match wits with the cunning and mysterious Cooley (Daniel von Bargen), who tracks the men, determined to bring them back to the prison farm. :: 294 :: With the words of a blind prophet ringing in their ears, You will find a fortune but not the fortune you seek, the three shackled escapees make a hasty run for their lives. They travel down the road on a journey filled with perils, surprises, and wondrous events. Along the way, they meet an assortment of curious characters including Tommy Johnson (Chris Thomas King), a musician on his way to Jackson to sing on the radio; Big Dan Teague (John Goodman), an unscrupulous, one-eyed Bible salesman who deceives them; Babyface Nelson (Michael Badalucco), the notorious gangster, who befriends them in the middle of a robbing spree; Penny Wharvey (Holly Hunter), an important part of Everett's not-so-distant past; and Governor Pappy O'Daniel (Charles Durning), who is engaged in a reelection campaign. :: 295 :: All the while the trio is trying to stay ahead of the law. Despite all the obstacles, near misses, and narrow escapes along the way, they reach Ithaca, where Delmar and Pete hope to be rewarded for their perseverance and Everett hopes to be reunited with more than his gold. :: 296 :: An exciting and entertaining blend of high adventure, humor, and heartfelt emotion, O Brother, Where Art Thou? is written and directed by Joel & Ethan Coen, two of today's preeminent filmmakers, who put their own unique modern-day spin on Homer's classic tale, The Odyssey. :: 297 :: See movie reviews below. :: 298 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 299 :: 	George Clooney :: 300 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=17794 :: 301 :: , :: 302 :: John Turturro :: 303 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=94180 :: 304 :: , :: 305 :: Tim Blake Nelson :: 306 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20013067 :: 307 :: , :: 308 :: Charles Durning :: 309 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=26584 :: 310 :: , :: 311 :: John Goodman :: 312 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=35688 :: 313 :: , :: 314 :: Michael Badalucco :: 315 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=4224 :: 316 :: , :: 317 :: Holly Hunter :: 318 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=44068 :: 319 :: , :: 320 :: Stephen Root :: 321 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=79706 :: 322 :: , :: 323 :: Chris Thomas King :: 324 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20017711 :: 325 :: , :: 326 :: Daniel Von Bargen :: 327 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=96201 :: 328 :: , :: 329 :: Musetta Vander :: 330 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=95109 :: 331 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 332 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/60020255.jpg :: 333 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60020255&trkid=28 :: 334 :: 	<BR/> :: 335 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 336 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 337 :: 	Everybody's Famous :: 338 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60020255&trkid=28 :: 339 :: 	<BR/> :: 340 :: 	Jean is a stage mother whose fondest wish is to see his plump daughter, Marva, attain fame as a singer (notoriety that eluded him in his youth). Millions tune in to CNN to see a real life and death drama in the Gulf War. As the U.S. Forces take a starring role, the P.R. department at the White House is working overtime. What they're looking for is a hero. What they find is a scandal. In a desperate race against time, one troubled soldier struggles to uncover the truth. :: 285 :: See movie reviews below. :: 286 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 287 :: The commentary track for Courage Under Fire is devoted to director Edward Zwick's recollections. Having cut his directing teeth on the Civil War drama Glory, Zwick is no stranger to battle scenes and addresses at length the challenges of coordinating Courage Under Fire's Desert Storm scenes. :: As the battle for the city rages, Vassili faces his ultimate challenge when the Nazi command dispatches its most elite marksman to hunt down and kill the man who has become the hope of all Russia. If you'd like to see the bonus material, please rent :: 283 :: <STRONG> Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace: Bonus Disc </STRONG> :: 284 :: . :: 285 :: Every Saga Has A Beginning. :: 286 :: The Phantom Menace is a journey back to the beginning of the epic saga to the era of the Republic. It follows the conflict over Naboo, a peaceful planet governed by Queen Amidala, which is threatened by the Trade Federation, puppets of the evil Sith. Through the struggle for Naboo's freedom, a momentous meeting occurs between Anakin Skywalker, a hopeful nine-year-old boy, and Obi-Wan Kenobi, a determined young Jedi, that will change the course of galactic history. The film follows Anakin as he pursues his dreams and confronts his fears in the midst of a galaxy in turmoil. Meanwhile Sith, in the form of the vicious Darth Maul, schemes to destroy the Jedi and control the Republic. :: 287 :: See movie reviews below. :: 288 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 289 :: 	Liam For additional bonus material, please rent :: 288 :: <STRONG> The Godfather Trilogy: Bonus Disc </STRONG> :: 289 :: . :: 290 :: One of the greatest sagas in movie history continues! In this third film in the epic Corleone trilogy, Al Pacino reprises the role of powerful family leader Michael Corleone. Now in his 60's, Michael is dominated by two passions: freeing his family from crime and finding a suitable successor. That successor could be fiery Vincent (Andy Garcia)... but he may also be the spark that turns Michael's hope of business legitimacy into an inferno of mob violence. :: 291 :: See movie reviews below. :: 292 :: <STRONG> About the DVD: </STRONG> :: 293 :: The restored film is presented in the original 1.85:1 aspect ratio, with anamorphic enhancement. The soundtrack is in Dolby 5.1 in English and French. Joseph Ryan (Frank Sinatra) is shot down and placed in a prison camp. Initially, he's more concerned with surviving than escaping, earning him the insulting nickname, Von Ryan. But in time, Ryan takes over from the commanding British officer (Trevor Howard) and masterminds a daredevil race for freedom that involves commandeering a train and getting it across Italy to Switzerland with the Nazis in hot pursuit. Rick O'Connell (Brendan Fraser) is now married to Evelyn (Rachel Weisz), and the couple has settled in London, where they are raising their 9-year-old son Alex (played by screen newcomer Freddie Boath). :: 293 :: When a chain of events finds the corpse of Imhotep (Arnold Vosloo) resurrected in the British Museum, the mummy Imhotep walks the earth once more, determined to fulfill his quest for immortality. But another force has also been set loose on the world... one born of the darkest rituals of ancient Egyptian mysticism, and even more powerful than Imhotep. When these two forces clash, the fate of the world will hang in the balance, sending the O'Connells on a desperate race to save the world from unspeakable evil, and rescue their son before it is too late. :: 294 :: See movie reviews below. :: 295 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 296 :: 	Brendan Fraser :: 297 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20000735 :: 298 :: , :: 299 :: Rachel Weisz After his master dies suddenly, the squire hits the road with his cohorts Roland and Wat. On the journey, they stumble across an unknown writer, Chaucer. William, lacking a proper pedigree, convinces Chaucer to forge genealogy documents that will pass him off as a knight. With his newly-minted history in hand, the young man sets out to prove himself a worthy knight at the country's jousting competition, and finds romance along the way. :: 286 :: See movie reviews below. :: 287 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 288 :: 	Heath Ledger :: 289 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20000005 :: 290 :: , :: 291 :: Mark Addy :: 292 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=191418 :: 293 :: , :: 294 :: Rufus Sewell :: 295 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=84324 :: 296 :: , :: 297 :: Paul Bettany :: 298 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20017662 :: 299 :: , :: 300 :: Shannyn Sossamon :: 301 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20027437 :: 302 :: , :: 303 :: Alan Tudyk :: 304 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20015557 :: 305 :: , :: 306 :: Laura Fraser :: 307 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20006971 :: 308 :: , :: 309 :: Christopher Cazenove :: 310 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20027438 :: 311 :: , :: 312 :: Berenice Bejo :: 313 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20027439 :: 314 :: , :: 315 :: Roger Ashton-Griffiths :: 316 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20023078 :: 317 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 318 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/60000021.jpg :: 319 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60000021&trkid=28 :: 320 :: 	<BR/> :: 321 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 322 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 323 :: 	Believe :: 324 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60000021&trkid=28 :: 325 :: 	<BR/> :: 326 :: 	Ben Stiles loves to scare people. If you'd like to see the bonus material, please rent :: 280 :: <STRONG> Cast Away: Bonus Disc </STRONG> :: 281 :: . :: 282 :: At the edge of the world, his journey begins. :: 283 :: In Cast Away, Academy Award-winning filmmaker Robert Zemeckis and two-time Oscar winner Tom Hanks reunite to explore the blessings and heartache of fate and the survival of the human spirit. :: 284 :: Hanks stars as Chuck Noland, a FedEx systems engineer whose personal and professional life are ruled by the clock. His fast-paced career takes him, often at a moment's notice, to far-flung locales -and away from his girlfriend Kelly, played by Helen Hunt. :: 285 :: Chuck's manic existence abruptly ends when, after a plane crash, he becomes isolated on a remote island - cast away into the most desolate environment imaginable. Stripped of the conveniences of everyday life, he first must meet the basic needs of survival, including water, food and shelter. Chuck, the consummate problem solver, eventually figures out how to sustain himself physically. But then what? Chuck begins his true personal journey. :: 286 :: After four years, fate gives Chuck a chance to fight his way back to civilization, only to find an unexpected emotional challenge greater than all the earlier physical ones. His ability to persevere and to hope are a product of his life-changing experience. Though the conclusion of Chuck's story may not be a conventional Hollywood ending, it is, like life, full of truth, pain and promise. :: 287 :: See movie reviews below. :: 288 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: For the widescreen version, please rent the bonus disc. </STRONG> :: 298 :: Once upon a time in a far away swamp, there lived an ornery ogre named Shrek (Mike Myers) whose precious solitude is suddenly shattered by an invasion of annoying fairy-tale characters. There are blind mice in his food, a big, bad wolf in his bed, three little homeless pigs and more, all banished from their kingdom by the evil Lord Farquaad (John Lithgow). Determined to save their home-not to mention his own-Shrek cuts a deal with Farquaad and sets out to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona (Cameron Diaz) to be Farquaad's bride. Accompanying him on his mission is a wisecracking Donkey (Eddie Murphy), who will do anything for Shrek ... except shut up. Rescuing the Princess from a fire-breathing dragon may prove the least of their problems when the deep, dark secret she has been keeping is revealed. :: 299 :: See movie reviews below. :: 300 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 301 :: 	Mike Myers :: 302 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=66904 :: 303 :: , :: 304 :: Eddie Murphy :: 305 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=66658 :: 306 :: , :: 307 :: Cameron Diaz :: 308 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=160536 :: 309 :: , :: 310 :: John Lithgow :: 311 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=55643 :: 312 :: , :: 313 :: Vincent Cassel :: 314 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20010957 :: 315 :: , :: 316 :: Jim Cummings :: 317 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=115197 :: 318 :: , :: 319 :: Kathleen Freeman :: 320 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20012620 :: 321 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 322 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/60020746.jpg :: 323 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60020746&trkid=28 :: 324 :: 	<BR/> :: 325 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 326 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 327 :: 	Dr. Dolittle 2 :: 328 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60020746&trkid=28 :: 329 :: 	<BR/> :: 330 :: 	Eddie Murphy talks to the animals once again in this well-loved family comedy. Unbeknownst to them, however, the city is on the brink or revolution, as pro-democracy rebels and anarchists alike threaten the stability of a crumbling dynasty. :: 269 :: See movie reviews below. :: Just before his good friend dies, Rafe makes a vow to look after his widow, Ann (Virginia Madsen), and promises to protect her Wyoming ranch. This strong code of honor leads Rafe and his two traveling companions, Rock and J.T. (David O'Hara and Christian Kane), to her small town, which is being terrorized by a conniving land owner, Bruce Barkow (Mark Harmon), and his hired gun, Bo Dorn (Brad Johnson). Rafe takes on Barkow, but Ann remains unsure of his motives. Ultimately, she must let her heart decide who to trust. :: 294 :: See movie reviews below. :: 295 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 296 :: 	Tom Selleck :: 297 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=84020 :: 298 :: , :: 299 :: Mark Harmon :: 300 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=39404 :: 301 :: , :: 302 :: Barry Corbin :: 303 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=14225 :: 304 :: , :: 305 :: William Sanderson :: 306 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=81900 :: 307 :: , :: 308 :: Joanna Miles :: 309 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20023315 :: 310 :: , :: 311 :: Rex Linn :: 312 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=55505 :: 313 :: , :: 314 :: Wilford Brimley :: 315 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=11260 :: 316 :: , :: 317 :: Brad Johnson :: 318 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=170703 :: 319 :: , :: 320 :: Christian Kane :: 321 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20027983 :: 322 :: , :: 323 :: Patrick Kilpatrick :: 324 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20017579 :: 325 :: , :: 326 :: Virginia Madsen :: 327 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=57946 :: 328 :: , :: 329 :: David O'Hara :: 330 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=69311 :: 331 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 332 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/60000563.jpg :: 333 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60000563&trkid=28 :: 334 :: 	<BR/> :: 335 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 336 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 337 :: 	To Walk with Lions :: 338 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60000563&trkid=28 :: 339 :: 	<BR/> :: 340 :: 	Legendary conservationist George Adamson first sprang onto the scene in the book and film Born Free. A world beneath what we call cyberspace. A world protected by firewalls, passwords and the most advanced security systems. In this world we hide our deepest secrets, our most incriminating information, and of course, a whole lot of money. This is the world of Swordfish. :: 296 :: Gabriel Shear (John Travolta), a charismatic and dangerous spy wanting to finance his own brand of patriotism, needs to get inside this world. If he can get in, billions in illegal government funds wait for the taking. To actually steal the money, however, he'll need a superhacker, someone whose talents make even the most airtight security systems of the world look like child's play. :: 297 :: That's where Stanley Jobson (Hugh Jackman) enters the picture. One of the two best hackers on the planet, Stanley has been forbidden to get within 50 yards of the nearest electronics store after doing time for wreaking havoc on the FBI's controversial high-tech cyber surveillance operations. Now Stanley is living out his life in a broken-down trailer, penniless, alone and without the one thing that gives his life meaning â€” his daughter Holly, whom he lost in a divorce. :: 298 :: Gabriel and his beautiful partner Ginger (Halle Berry) lure Stanley into their clandestine world, baiting him with the one thing he can't have â€” a chance to reunite with Holly and start a new life. But once Stanley enters their world, he realizes that nothing in this operation is what it seems and he has become a pawn in a plot that's a lot more sinister than a high-tech bank heist. :: 299 :: Log on. The son of a Kentucky sharecropper, Carl leaves home for what he expects would be a better life. Never quit ... be the best, his father had told him, and Carl takes those words to heart. :: 289 :: After he joins the newly-integrated Navy, Carl spends two years writing a hundred letters before the service accepts his application for its Dive School program. Carl's training officer, Billy Sunday, wants no part of Carl or his ambitions. Sunday, a celebrated Master Chief Navy Diver whose exploits as a troublemaker are as legendary as his accomplishments as a diver, relentlessly taunts and challenges Carl, expecting him to falter and quit. But Carl has other ideas. His goal is clear, his determination fixed. Nothing will stand in the way of his dream of becoming a Navy Diver. Not even Billy Sunday. :: 290 :: Years later, after Carl suffers a crippling injury, he and Sunday unexpectedly join forces. Never one to turn down an opportunity to flout the system, the rebellious senior officer helps Carl buck Navy bureaucracy, overcome the loss of a leg, and go on to make military history. By the time he retires, Carl earns the esteemed titles of Master Diver and Master Chief, the Navy's highest rank for an enlisted man. :: 291 :: See movie reviews below. :: 292 :: 	<STRONG> Cast: </STRONG> :: 293 :: 	George Tillman Jr. :: 294 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20004633 :: 295 :: , :: 296 :: Robert De Niro :: 297 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=22588 :: 298 :: , :: 299 :: Cuba Gooding Jr. :: 300 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=35668 :: 301 :: , :: 302 :: Charlize Theron :: 303 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=179780 :: 304 :: , :: 305 :: Aunjanue Ellis :: 306 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20016612 :: 307 :: , :: 308 :: Hal Holbrook :: 309 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=42505 :: 310 :: , :: 311 :: Michael Rapaport :: 312 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=76345 :: 313 :: , :: 314 :: Powers Boothe :: 315 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20002788 :: 316 :: , :: 317 :: David Keith :: 318 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=48589 :: 319 :: , :: 320 :: Joshua Leonard :: 321 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20000731 :: 322 :: , :: 323 :: David Conrad :: 324 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=18887 :: 325 :: , :: 326 :: Bill Cosby :: 327 :: http://www.netflix.com/RoleDisplay?personid=20002539 :: 328 :: 	<STRONG> Members Also Enjoyed </STRONG> :: 329 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/boxshots/small/60000191.jpg :: 330 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60000191&trkid=28 :: 331 :: 	<BR/> :: 332 :: 	http://a408.g.akamai.net/f/408/1284/24h/image.netflix.com/NetFlix_Assets/labels/rent_big03.gif :: 333 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/VerifyMembership :: 334 :: 	Rules of Engagement :: 335 :: 	http://www.netflix.com/MovieDisplay?movieid=60000191&trkid=28 :: 336 :: 	<BR/> :: 337 :: 	Sensing a crisis in Yemen, the U.S. government sends Col.
